content.description: Figure 1. The rate of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> uptake for three species of Saccharomyces yeast at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30°C</mtext></math> and <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>35°C</mtext></math>
content.question: Researchers studied the effect of increased temperature on the rate of respiration of three species of Saccharomyces yeast (<math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>, and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>) by measuring the rate of oxygen uptake in each species at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30°C</mtext></math> and at <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>35°C</mtext></math> (Figure 1). Based on Figure 1, which of the following statements about the effect of the temperature increase on the respiratory rate of one of the species, <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>, or <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>, is most likely true?

choices.label: The median <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> uptake rate for species <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> at <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>35°C</mtext></math> is <math alttext="0.1 microliter per milligram per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>0.1 μL·mg</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·min</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> less than it is at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30°C</mtext></math>.

The range from minimum to maximum <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> uptake rate for species <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> at <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>35°C</mtext></math> is <math alttext="0.1 microliter per milligram per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>0.1 μL·mg</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·min</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> more than it is at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30°C</mtext></math>.

The median <math alttext="O sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> uptake rate for species <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> at <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>35°C</mtext></math> is the same as it is at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30°C</mtext></math>.

The range of the <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> uptake rate for species <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> at <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>35°C</mtext></math> is the same as it is at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30°C</mtext></math>.

content.answer: The median <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> uptake rate for species <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> at <math alttext="35 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>35°C</mtext></math> is <math alttext="0.1 microliter per milligram per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>0.1 μL·mg</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·min</mtext><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> less than it is at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>30°C</mtext></math>.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
